title: Towards Neural Audio Codec Source Parsing
author: Orchid Chetia Phukan (IIIT-Delhi, India), Girish (UPES, India), Mohd Mujtaba Akhtar (V.B.S.P.U, India), Arun Balaji Buduru (IIIT-Delhi, India), Rajesh Sharma (University of Tartu, Estonia), ...
relevance_why: The novel approach to analyze and parse audio codec parameters can enhance Haohe Liu's existing work in audio generation and restoration, particularly in understanding and optimizing audio synthesis processes.
background: Neural Audio Codec Source Parsing aims to identify underlying codec parameters used in generating deepfake audio, addressing challenges posed by open-set conditions where unknown codecs may appear.
contribution: This paper introduces Neural Audio Codec Source Parsing to solve the limitations in traditional source attribution methods, achieving structured regression over audio codec parameters for more efficient identification.
technical_comparison: Previous methods for audio attribution primarily focused on binary classification, often failing to distinguish features of unseen codecs. This work improves upon them by employing a structured regression framework that considers generative parameters of audio codecs.
key_innovation: Proposes the use of hyperbolic geometry to separate feature representations, allowing for enhanced prediction accuracy across multiple tasks related to audio codecs.
real_world_impact: This research can significantly improve the reliability of audio deepfake detection systems, enhancing forensic capabilities and security in audio communications among other applications.
limitations: The authors mention the model's dependency on extensive training data for optimal performance, possibly limiting its applicability to datasets with sufficient diversity.

new_terms.codecfakes: **Codecfakes** refer to a new class of audio deepfakes generated using neural audio codecs, posing unique detection challenges.
new_terms.Neural Audio Codec Source Parsing: **Neural Audio Codec Source Parsing (NACSP)** is a proposed framework for analyzing the parameters of audio codecs to improve source attribution for generated audio.

open_sourcing: We will release the source code and model checkpoints upon completion of double-blind review to facilitate future research for NACSP.
